metadata.title: CVE-2019-5544 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenSLP as used in ESXi and the Horizon DaaS appliances has a heapoverwrite issue. VMware has evaluated the severity of this issue to be inthe Critical severity range with a maximum CVSSv3 base score of 9.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5544` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libslp1 - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.3+esm1
slpd - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.3+esm1
slptool - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openslp-dfsg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-9ubuntu0.3+esm1').
